page.title: 03BRENDON HILL FARM
page.content: Brendon Hill Farm consists of 800-900 acres (320-360 hectares). Swedes and Kale are grown here and on good years corn can be grown as well. Fertilizers and natural manure are used to improve the crops. Livestock on the farm includes 150 cattle, 1500 breeding sheep with up to 1500 lambs in the lambing season. Geese and pigs are kept and there are about 20 horses on the farm at any one time. A famous one time olympic horse woman bought her champion "Priceless" from this farm along with another horse called "Nightcap". The mother of "Priceless" is now dead but the father ("Benfairie") still lives on the farm. He sires up to 20 foals every year.
